text: and we like to ask about our tips and
tricks for surviving the week so what
are your ways that you survive reinvent
every year yeah I think survive is the
right term the disadvantage of such a
full action-packed conference is that
you know it's up at the crack of dawn
down late late at night and so you're
going nonstop but one tip that's always
served me well throughout the years
is about a month before reinvent go buy
a good pair of sneakers and you are
going to be walking a ridiculous amount
and I think it was two years ago I
didn't leave the Venetian Palazzo just
because I had a lot of meetings and
sessions and everything was there and I
still did about 15 kilometres a day just
walking back and forth between my room
and various of venues who are within the
property and you need a good pair of
sneakers preferably but good strong
Footwear to get you through the day and
then you can you know mix it up for
fashion at night but you if you're not
picking a good set of Footwear you
weren't going to be paying so you know
as a community here obviously I'm sure
you want people to come up to and chat
with you what what is your sort of
approach at reinvent in terms of had a
network and talk to people and really
sort of again sort of continue to get
the most out of that social aspect of
reinvent yeah I think the biggest thing
so as a community hero as a speaker I
think that the biggest part of my week
is interacting with people it's meeting
new people it's making new connections
it's hearing how people are solving
interesting problems you know and it's
challenging with all the great stuff
being announced all the great content
but I think it's really important for
people to understand that social aspect
um is critical you're all physically
there and that kind of face-to-face
interaction is great so people you know
talking to me when I'm in line for
coffee or before a session that's
amazing that's the highlight of my week
so yeah we connect on social media and
you know I'll be streaming throughout
the week from from the show and but
really it is that personal touch and I
think people need to remember that
because it can be awkward yeah you know
the easiest way is just hi how's it
going what did you get out of that
session or what are you looking to get
out of this session we are all there for
the same reason we're all there to learn
to improve our skills to be better
developers to be better part of the
community it starts with a simple eye
